members.description: The label to display in the address bar. This will override the domain that shows when using `href`.

members.name: href
members.description:
When set, the address bar will be wrapped by a link that goes to this URL. A human-readable domain name will be
shown in the address bar unless `label` is also provided.

members.name: target
members.description: Opens the link in the specified target. Only works when `href` is set.

members.name: rel
members.description:
Sets the link's `rel` attribute.  Only works when `href` is set. When linking to an external domain, you should
probably set this to `noreferrer noopener`.

members.name: download
members.description: Sets the link's `download` attribute, causing the linked file to be downloaded. Only works when `href` is set.

members.name: flush
members.description:
When set, removes all padding from the body element and removes border radius from slotted media. Useful for
displaying images and videos that span edge-to-edge in the browser frame.

members.name: platform
members.description:
Sets the window control style to use. 'mac' uses the traffic light controls, 'windows' uses Windows 11-style
controls, and 'auto' will use the most appropriate style based on the user's operating system.

members.description:
Gets the current value as a hex string, a hex8 string, an RGB object, or an HSL object. RBG objects have `r`, `g`,
and `b` properties ranging from 0255 and an `a` property (representing opacity) that ranges from 0-1. HSL objects
have an `h` property ranging from `0-359` and `s`, `l`, and `a` properties ranging from 01.

longer in the viewport. This allows you to apply styles to elements as they enter and exit the viewport using pure
CSS.

members.description:
The form to associate this control with. If omitted, the closest containing `<form>` will be used. The value of
this attribute must be an ID of a form in the same document or shadow root.

members.name: required
members.description: Makes the listbox required. Form submission will not be allowed when this is set and the listbox is blank.

members.name: value
members.description: The listbox's value. For multiple selection, this will be the value of the first selected item.

members.name: selectedValues
members.description:
Gets or sets the currently selected values as an array. This property provides a consistent way to access or modify
the selection state regardless of whether the listbox is in single or multiple selection mode.

In single selection mode, it returns an array with either zero or one value. In multiple selection mode, it returns
an array of all selected values.

When setting this property in single mode, the first value in the array (if any) becomes the selected value. In
multiple mode, all values in the array become selected.

members.name: selectedItems
members.description: Gets or sets an array of selected listbox items.

members.name: updateValueFromSelectedItems
members.description:
Updates the current value to align with selected items. We track user interaction to allow us to dispatch events
when human changes are made and suppress them for programmatic changes.

members.name: getSelectedValues
members.description: Returns an array of all selected values.

members.name: setSelectedValues
members.description:
Sets the selected items by value(s) without triggering events.
Works for both single and multiple selection modes.

members.description: Convenience method for selecting all items.

members.description:

with a non-zero number and force it to output the same content every time.

of `{min}-{max}`, e.g. `4-16`.

members.description: A seed value for consistent gradient generation. If not provided, the gradient will be random.

members.name: adjustBrightness
members.description:
Adjusts the brightness of an HSL color using a hybrid tint/shade approach. Positive values tint the color
(lighten + desaturate) and negative values shade it (darken only).

members.description: Extracts the HSL values from any CSS color format using TinyColor.

members.description: Detects the current base color and brightness, and regenerates the gradient if needed.

members.description: Generates an array of HSL colors based on color theory, preserving the base color's characteristics.

members.description: Generates the CSS gradient styles.

members.description: Gets the current value of `--gradient-color` from computed styles.

members.name: getBrightness
members.description: Gets the current value of `--brightness` from computed styles.

members.name: getOptimalTextColor
members.description: Determines the optimal text color (black or white) based on the background color.

members.name: getPosition
members.description: Calculates gradient positions, either randomly or based on a seed.

members.name: handleColorTransition
members.description:
Handles the `transitionend` event to detect when `--gradient-color` or `--brightness` changes. The 1ms transitions
on the `color` and `z-index` properties trigger this.

members.name: hslToString
members.description: Formats an HSL object as a CSS HSL string.

members.name: randomHsl
members.description: Creates a random HSL color for when no base color is provided.

members.name: regenerate
members.description: Regenerates the gradient. Useful for creating new random gradients programmatically.

members.name: number
members.description: The number to format.

members.name: type
members.description: The formatting style to use.

members.name: currency
members.description:
The currency to use when formatting currency. Must be an ISO 4217 currency code, e.g. "EUR" for euro. If not
provided, USD will be assumed.

members.name: currencyDisplay
members.description: How to display the currency in currency formatting.

members.name: currencySign
members.description: In many locales, accounting format means to wrap the number with parentheses instead of appending a minus sign.

members.name: unit
members.description:
The unit to use in unit formatting. [Possible values can be found here.](https://tc39.es/ecma402/#table-sanctioned-single-unit-identifiers)
There is no default value. If the style is `unit`, this option must be provided.

members.name: unitDisplay
members.description: The unit formatting style to use in unit formatting.

members.name: minimumIntegerDigits
members.description:
The minimum number of integer digits to use. A value with a smaller number of integer digits than this number will
be left-padded with zeros (to the specified length) when formatted. Possible values are from `1` to `21`. The
default is `1`.

members.name: minimumFractionDigits
members.description: The minimum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are from `0` to `20`.

members.name: maximumFractionDigits
members.description: The maximum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are from `0` to `20`.

members.name: minimumSignificantDigits
members.description: The minimum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are from `1` to `21`; the default is `1`.

members.name: maximumSignificantDigits
members.description: The maximum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are from `1` to `21`; the default is `21`.

members.name: roundingPriority
members.description: Specifies how rounding conflicts will be resolved.

members.name: roundingIncrement
members.description:
Indicates the increment at which rounding should take place relative to the calculated rounding magnitude. Possible
values are `1`, `2`, `5`, `10`, `20`, `25`, `50`, `100`, `200`, `250`, `500`, `1000`, `2000`, `2500`, and `5000`.
Cannot be mixed with significant-digits rounding or any setting of `roundingPriority` other than auto.

members.name: roundingMode
members.description: How decimals should be rounded. [See this page for more details.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/NumberFormat/NumberFormat#roundingmode)

members.name: trailingZeroDisplay
members.description: The strategy for displaying trailing zeros on whole numbers.

members.name: notation
members.description: The formatting that should be displayed for the number.

members.name: compactDisplay
members.description: Only used when `notation` is `compact`.

members.name: grouping
members.description: Whether to use grouping separators, such as thousands separators or thousand/lakh/crore separators.

members.name: signDisplay
members.description: When to display the sign for the number.

cssParts.description: The container that wraps the slotted items. Displays as a flex column by default.
cssParts.name: items

slots.description: One or more elements to be searched. Each element must be a direct descendent of the host, i.e. do not wrap items in other containers. If desired, you can apply flex and grid styles to the `items` part to control how items appear in the list. By default, items will be displayed in a flex column.
A `<quiet-text-field>` or `<input>` element that will control the search list.

slots.description: Optional content to display when no search query has been entered.
slots.name: initial

slots.description: Optional content to display when the search yields no results.

members.name: controller
members.description:
In most cases, you should slot the controller into the `controller` slot. However, when the controller must exist
outside the search list, you can set this property to the ID of an external `<input>` or `<quiet-text-field>`
element instead.

members.name: match
members.description:
The search behavior to use when finding a matching item. The `exact` search is case-insensitive but requires an
exact match. The `fuzzy` search is more forgiving to typos. When using `custom`, you can set the `isMatch` property
to a custom function to determine if the provided query matches the element's content.

members.name: debounce
members.description: The time in milliseconds to use for debouncing the search results while the user types.

members.name: isMatch

type.text: (query: string, content: string, el: Element) => boolean

members.description:
A custom search function you can provide to change the search behavior. The function is applied to each item when
the search query changes. The `query` argument is the current search term, `content` is a string containing the
element's searchable content, including its `textContent` and `data-keywords"`, and `el` is the element being
searched. Property only.

members.name: getController
members.description: Gets the controller or returns `null` if one can't be found.

members.name: handleControllerInput
members.description: Updates results when the controller's value changes.

members.name: handleDocumentInput
members.description: Listens to all `input` events on the document and responds only to controller events.

members.name: setQuery
members.description: Sets the search query and updates the results. To clear the search, set this to an empty string.

attributes.name: controller
attributes.description:
In most cases, you should slot the controller into the `controller` slot. However, when the controller must exist
outside the search list, you can set this property to the ID of an external `<input>` or `<quiet-text-field>`
element instead.

attributes.name: match
attributes.description:
The search behavior to use when finding a matching item. The `exact` search is case-insensitive but requires an
exact match. The `fuzzy` search is more forgiving to typos. When using `custom`, you can set the `isMatch` property
to a custom function to determine if the provided query matches the element's content.

attributes.name: debounce
attributes.description: The time in milliseconds to use for debouncing the search results while the user types.

declarations.name: QuietTransitionGroup

cssProperties.description: The duration of each individual step (not the total transition time).
cssProperties.name: --duration

slots.description: One or more elements to transition when adding, removing, and reordering the DOM.

members.name: isTransitioning
members.description: Determines if the transition group is currently animating. (Property only)

members.name: transitionAnimation
members.description:
A custom animation to use for enter/exit transitions. Works well with animations from `@quietui/scurry`.
(Property only)

members.name: transitionContainer
members.description:
By default, the transition group observes and animates its own children. In some cases, you may want it to control
another element's children. This is useful in cases where you can't directly wrap child elements with the
`<quiet-transition-group>` element.

For example, if you embed a transition group in a component's shadow root but need it to control slotted (light
DOM) elements, you can't simply wrap the slot because the mutation observer can't see projected (slotted) elements.
In this case, point this property to the target element and the transition group will hide itself and observe the
target container's children instead. (Property only)

members.name: disableTransitions
members.description:
Disables transition animations. However, the `quiet-content-changed` and `quiet-transition-end` events will still
be dispatched.

members.name: ignoreReducedMotion
members.description:
By default, no animation will occur when the user indicates a preference for reduced motion. Use this attribute to
override this behavior when necessary.

members.name: getAnimation
members.description: Gets a custom animation based on the users preference. If a custom animation isn't found, the default is returned.

members.name: transitionComplete
members.description:
Returns a promise that resolves when the current transition ends. If no transition is running, it resolves
immediately  This is a great way to ensure transitions have stopped before doing something else, such as adding or
removing new elements to the transition group.

members.name: updateElementPositions
members.description:
Updates the cached coordinates of all child elements in the transition group. In most cases, you shouldn't have to
call this method. However, if you're resizing or animating elements imperatively, you may need to call this
immediately before appending or removing elements to ensure a smooth transition.

events.description: Emitted when content changes and before the transition animation begins.
events.name: quiet-content-changed

events.description: Emitted when transition animations end.
events.name: quiet-transition-end

attributes.name: ignore-reduced-motion

override this behavior when necessary.

package.name: @quietui/quiet
